definition[0]: to give someone such as the police a secret warning or piece of information, especially about illegal activities
example[0]: The police must have been tipped off.
example[1]: His contact had tipped him off that drugs were on the premises.
example[2]: Did you tip him off about Bernard?
definition[1]: a secret warning or piece of information, especially one given to the police about illegal activities
example[3]: The arrests came after a tip-off from a member of the public.
definition[2]: something that shows you that something is true, even though you did not expect it to be true
example[4]: The fact that he hasn’t called should be a tip-off that he’s not interested.
definition[3]: the beginning of a basketball game, when the ball is thrown into the air and two players jump up to try to gain control of it
